content.rendered:
From simple and spare to complex and patterned, we have a healthy range of projects with work from Berlin, London, and Eindhoven.

PLOT by HORT

PLOT is a printed and online magazine in Germany focused on creative spaces with an audience of set designers, (interior) architects, and stage and set designers. Art-directed by Berlin-based HORT, their identity for the publication makes its own creative use of space by having a literally flexible logo that can make the best use of a canvas by extending any of its letters. The squared off wordmark is as simple as it gets but the unapologetically big use in the letterhead and business cards against the small, minimal typography makes for a unique, very noticeable look. See full project

The Palomar by Here

Just like The Palomar in London brings together a mix of flavors from various spots in the world, the identity by local firm Here brings together a number of eclectic visuals. Case in point: Eurostile! Which works remarkably well in the bold weight (not at all in the light weight) as a complement to the quirky script wordmark. Used full-bleed in some cases, the wordmark divides the area where it sits into two colors — a move that usually renders amateurish results but here it’s oddly convincing. Then there is some funky, wavy patterns that make good use of the lovely color palette of baby and dark blue, salmon, tan, and gold. Again, kind of weird, but it works so well in the overall package. Plus, gold foil is having a moment these days. See full project here.

TextielMuseum and Lab by Raw Color

Located in Tilburg, The Netherlands, the TextielMuseum and TextielLab, as their name imply, are devoted to textiles. For their shared identity, Eindhoven-based Raw Color, took the “T”, “M”, and “L” initials to create an overlaid logo that changes its color and opacity to shift the focus to the museum or the lab. It also lends itself to a variety of stunning patterns that have been produced by the Lab, including these lovely dish towels that look more like they should be hung from a wall in display instead of hanging over the kitchen sink. See full project.
